reviews.review_msg: THIS PROFESSOR IS AMAZING. I have no clue why others keep giving him bad grade. He's super nice and very helpful. Worth taking a course with him for sure! If you cannot survive his class you should not be able to call yourself an economics major. He's very easy and very very good!

He is very nice and helpful, if you go to his office, he will be always help you, although the assignments are too difficult,the exams are easier, if you study all the assignments, tutorial question and lecture notes, it would be fine.

so regard taking with him! He talked too fast during lecture and feels like he is giving lecture to students who do well in the class. When I tried to ask question after class, I confused even more after and he kept saying 'it's all in the note/text'; wtx would I need a instructor if I can fully understand the material by myself...
WOW....

Instead of teaching actual material in the course, this power trip spends time plotting way in which to punish students.  The material he does teach is a bunch of formulas with no explanation as to how it relates into developmental economics.

I recommend taking all of your classes with Georgi.  He is a great professor and is not on a power trip at all.  His exams are so easy you can write them with your eyes closed.   This course and professor are definitely a GPA booster.  Best of all, if you miss a class you can teach yourself the material using the $200 textbook he demands you buy.
lecture notes are very disorganized and confusing. The assignments are even worse however graded very strictly
His lecture notes are disorganized and the lecture itself is very confusing. The assignments are even worse however graded very strictly
very confusing lecture,notes are disorganized. assignemnts are even worse and very strictly graded.

Believe you me, stay away from this prof. First he gives a bunch of textbook recommendations, then after people buy them, decides not to use them. You have nothing to fall back on because his teaching abilities are so poor , he tries to punish his students. Makes mistakes all the time, thinks he knows what he's doing but he really doesn't.

I got 95% in the quizzes... and something like 50% for the weekly op-eds. Completely nonsense criteria for grading them, no consistency week to week. It seemed like TAs would flip a coin whether an op-ed would pass, one week I pass, one week I don't, one week I pass, one week I don't... Better than my friend who never passed a single one I guess.

Chris is one of the best professors in the Econ department. The course was graded on weekly quizzes (40%) which were pretty difficult most weeks. The course also has weekly writing assignments (30%) which are easy if you're a good writer. 20% of the grade is a major writing assignment...don't worry its short and similar to the weekly assignments.

Honestly, very knowledgeable and one of the best communicators I've ever met. Absolutely take the course! The marking was very fair and Chris gives great feedback! Also encourages creative questions! The only con to the course was the tutorials, which were exceedingly painful because of the entire lack of English proficiency by the student body.
Heavy weight on online weekly quizzes which are hard af.
Avoid Him....

Really great professor. Notes are clear and explains concepts really well so that you don't even need to read the book. Assignments are relatively interesting and aren't too difficult. Midterm and Final's are fair but the quantitative parts involving math are definitely challenging and tricky.
Great professor. Very informative class sessions. Very organized content. Highly recommend her.

Dr. Nazir's lectures are full of interesting facts related to Economics development. She includes topics related to countries and case studies to explain application of concepts. Excellent presentations and helpful web resources make her a great instructor.  She is an asset for SFU.

Maliha is awful at lecturing and unhinged most of the time. She goes around the class asking students where they are from (very cringe!) If you are sitting in her lecture room, get ready to be pointed out by her. She tends to target certain students in class by asking questions. She definitely has her favorites, biased prof.
Great overall!

Highly knowledgeable; potential to be an excellent lecturer.  However, he is extremely rude, abrasive, and intransigent.  A number of my classmates shared the same concerns; his demeanor and unpredictablilty with respect to mood and attitude do not create a healthy or encouraging environment in which to learn.

Great Prof Overall. 
Pro: Interesting lectures, lots of practice exams, easy to follow materials. 
Cons: Heavy Argentinian Accent (hard for International like me), VERY HEAVY WORKLOAD, lots of readings.
Good professor. We also had recorded lectures so could always refer back to them. Clear slides and explanation. Lots of written assignments to do, similar to Econ 220W.

He is really laid back for the most part, but he doesn't mess around when it comes to cheaters. If you show up to lecture and pay attention, you will do well on the exams. Expectations are fair for written assignments. Really easy to follow his content and he is available if you need extra help. Definitely one of the best lecturers at SFU.
Martin is a great prof. He makes the topic look easy and tries hard to make the class fun. He is also very knowledgeable

Absolutely my fav prof at sfu!!! Have taken 2 courses with him and both were great! He is just so chill and always delays the deadlines. Overall not hard for a 4-unit course. Just have to write a few papers and 2 exams. Talk to the TAs for revision for your paper and study the lecture notes for the exams and you will be good.

Professor Santamaria is quite good! The material was dry at parts, but he trys to make it more interesting. If you have a solid econ background I think you'll find Econ355W quite easy, but I got tripped up with some of the models. Good mix of assignments and he gives you practice midterms/finals that are accurate. Attending class makes it easier!

Econ355W is upper writing course but it comes easy if you take this profs class. 5 essays no more than 500 words each in entire term. Super easy exam, no formula derivation, no essay on exams, Just some simple math and model theory.

Great professor overall. Very easy to follow, explains things very well. Even when material is dry he finds a way to make it interesting. His exams are very straight forward, if you study and attend lectures you will get a good grade.
